Articles.Content:
yeah, I'm taking that other thread and turning it around.

Is there any body in the system that seems like a good luck charm to you? Where missions always seem to go smoothly?

For me, its probably Duna. Never had anything go wrong on Duna or Ike.
Several actually, Mun, Minmus, Tylo oddly enough, Dres and Eeloo.
Minmus and I are in a loving relationship and plan to get married.

Kerbin. No Kerbal of mine has ever died on Kerbin.

But then again, that might just be my tendency to MOAR PARACHUTES! AND WINGS! AND PARACHUTES ON WINGS!

Minmus is definitely a fun place to visit, I had a base there for a while.

Thats where I learned precision landing
Mun: it loves hugging my spacecraft!
Eeloo, I've sent a couple of missions out that way, still no failures. But saying that, I've not had any manned or return missions yet.
I've never had any problems with Minmus missions. Gilly, while easy, is actually pretty tedious because its orbital velocity is so low and you're limited to 1x time acceleration if you get too close.
Kerbin. My missions to Kerbin almost never fail.
The Mun, most of the time, and Minmus. I haven't been any farther yet.

Minmus and I are in a loving relationship and plan to get married.

Same here. <3 Minmus
Who else is always watching over me as i get away, and leave Kerbins SOI?Minmus, please sit down...
Never gone farther than the Mun, but planning (hoping) to go to Minmus soon.
Every one of them. None of them wants me to leave after landing
Jool, oddly.
Kerbin loves me so much it rarely lets me leave

My Let's Play series to colonize Laythe has so far also brought me to Mun, Minmus, Jool, Duna and Gilly, and I would honestly have to say Laythe is a bit of a charm for me. I've had absolutely stupid amounts of luck with it, always getting an encounter when I need one despite wild and radically uncontrolled Jool orbits. The very first time I reached it, I was sending a tiny unmanned probe out, because I had yet to unlock anything better from career mode and I simply wanted to see what the fuel requirements would be like for getting me out there. This was the probe:

Believe it or not, I actually nailed a successful water landing with this. The only reason it didn't survive was because after I'd landed it, my brain panicked and I failed to cut the engines at the appropriate time, making it bounce back up in the water and break itself on the way down.

Since then, I've made numerous flights there, the most recent being to land the entire colony vehicle (video next week), all of which have gone relatively smoothly compared to most of my missions. So yes, I would honestly have to say that Laythe just smiles and holds its arms out every time it sees me coming.

bop,the safest moon to land on yet, the only moon or planet i haven't crashed on:D...thanks to alternis kerbol:wink:

Edited January 30, 2014 by Jupiter02
Minmus. When other planets destroy any confidence I had in my plans, Minmus is always there for me.
Minmus. When a homebound probe ran low on fuel, I kicked it towards Minmus and landed on RCS. Gotta love the [lack of] gravity.
Eve: It loves my craft so much that it never returns it
Minmus has never given me problems. I love Minmus.
Minmus. I think it's because of how close it is to Kerbin and because of the really low gravity.
The Mun. The biggest spaceships/rockets/pobes/base/kerbalnauts/rovers/spaceplanes/stations graveyard in my KSP game.

The Mun. The biggest spaceships/rockets/pobes/base/kerbalnauts/rovers/spaceplanes/stations graveyard in my KSP game.

Truer words hath seldom been spoken.
